DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether cognitive-behavioral group prevention (CBT-G) for german children is effective and to what extent parental group training moderates outcome.
DOC.detailed_description: Internalizing disorders represent a large group of psychological disorders among children who are referred to psychological treatment. Anxiety, Depression and somatoform disorders in children and adolescents increase the risk of mental disorders in adulthood. Some english programs have proved the efficacy of CBT-G prevention.This study will test the efficacy of CBT-G in German children. The role of parental involvement is currently subject to scientific discussions. The impact of an additional parent-group training will be investigated.
DOC.criteria: age 8 12 years and anxiety symptoms and/or depressive symptoms and/or somatoform symptoms psychiatric disorder according to ICD10/ DSMIVTR requiring individual psychotherapy IQ < 85
